intro: Bahia artemisiifolia var. douglasii, commonly known as Douglas's wormwood, is a variant of the common wormwood plant. It is a perennial herb native to the western United States, characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, gray-green leaves. The plant produces tiny, yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the Asteraceae family. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its botanical features make it identifiable by its aromatic foliage and distinctive floral structure.
